Judy,

If you removed the correct pin. and Your all back together Just turn=
 on the power 
and press the up or down arrow for about a second the radio =
should scan and continue
with out stopping.


  ----- Original Message ----=
- 
  From: judy_in_hollywood 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday=
, November 30, 2007 10:27 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: OK, Now what? Help!

=


  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote=
:
  >
  > 
  > That's what mine did when I cut the green wire. So I patched=
 that, flipped the board over so I could see which wire the mute was on, it=
 was a blue wire, then miss counted, cut the worng wire again, patched that=
, then unsoldered the right one. You might make sure none of the pins short=
ed. 
  > 
  > Frank
  > 
  > 
  > To: EVP-ITC@...: Ticket_to_Heaven@...: Sa=
t, 1 Dec 2007 04:56:46 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] OK, Now what? Help!
  > 
  >=
 
  > 
  > 
  > Hi All, Well, it took longer than 10 minutes to pull the Mu=
te pin . . . or should I say, after moving it back & forth a bit, it broke =
off! Oh, well, I got it off! Then after I put it all back together, I turne=
d it on, and on AM (light comes on, but goes off, to see what station numbe=
r it's on), but for the most part, it still acts like a digtal AM/FM radio!=
 Am I doing something wrong??? Hmmm? Help! 8-/ =3DJudy=3D 
  > 
  > 
  > 
 =
 > 
  > 
  > 
  > _________________________________________________________=
_
  > Your smile counts. The more smiles you share, the more we donate.  Jo=
in in.
  > www.windowslive.com/smile?ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_Wave2_oprsmilewlhmtag=
line
  >
  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Hi Frank & All, Hmmm?! I thought=
 all one has to do was remove the Mute pin! Now, you say I've got to look a=
t the revese side from where the pin was and cut(!?) or undo (somehow) a wi=
re that that pin connects to? If I do all this the right way, how does the =
radio work/sound,then? I'm confused, at this point. I also can plug in exte=
rnal, but small, speakers rather than use the earbuds. =3DJudy=3D P.S. How =
can I tell if a pin has shorted?? . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
